channel.title: mycatalog updates
channel.description: 'My Catalog' uses the IBM Cloud catalog API to retrieve data from the catalog. It attempts to be as accurate as possible. This feed shows additions, updates, removals from the catalog. Use with care. It is a work-in-progress :)

item.title: [added] InstructLab (instructlab)
item.description: Simplify, scale, and secure the alignment of LLMsâ€” addressing the challenges enterprises face in ownership, accuracy, and efficiency.

item.title: [updated] Databases for PostgreSQL (databases-for-postgresql) has a new plan named standard-satellite
item.description: One highly available PostgreSQL instance with two data members. The Standard for Satellite plan is priced based on vCPUs allocated to deployments, prorated hourly. Databases for PostgreSQL instances have a minimum of 5GB of Disk, 1GB of RAM, and 6 cores per data member.

item.title: [updated] Databases for Redis (databases-for-redis) has a new plan named standard-satellite
item.description: One highly available Redis instance with two data members. The Standard for Satellite plan is priced based on vCPUs allocated to deployments, prorated hourly. Databases for Redis instances have a minimum of 1GB of Disk, 1GB of RAM, and 6 cores per data member.

item.title: [updated] Messages for RabbitMQ (messages-for-rabbitmq) has a new plan named standard-satellite
item.description: One highly available RabbitMQ instance with three data members. The Standard for Satellite plan is priced based on vCPUs allocated to deployments, prorated hourly. Messages for RabbitMQ instances have a minimum of 1GB of Disk, 1GB of RAM, and 6 cores per data member.

item.title: [updated] watsonx Assistant (conversation) has removed the plan named plus-trial
[updated] watsonx Code Assistant (code-assistant) was made available in the Frankfurt catalog
